title: Fix missing footer navigation icons, restore badge/owner badge, and update app logo

requirements.text: Fix the mobile bottom navigation footer so it never shows broken image placeholders: ensure all footer icons render correctly for Home, Stories, Chat, Notifications, and Profile.

quotes: The icons are not shoing and the badge is also not shoing fix it
The navigation footer bar has no icons and the owner badge
Do it by yourself make the suitable icons

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile breakpoints, the bottom navigation shows five visible icons (Home, Stories, Chat, Notifications, Profile) with no broken-image placeholders.
If any icon asset fails to load, the UI still renders a suitable fallback icon (no empty/broken state).
Active icon styling (the existing invert/brightness behavior) still works.

requirements.text: Provide a complete set of suitable navigation icon assets that match the app’s premium dark theme and the existing asset paths referenced by the footer.

quotes: Do it by yourself make the suitable icons

acceptanceCriteria: The following files exist in the frontend static assets and load successfully at runtime: /assets/generated/nav-icon-home.dim_128x128.png, /assets/generated/nav-icon-stories.dim_128x128.png, /assets/generated/nav-icon-chat.dim_128x128.png, /assets/generated/nav-icon-notifications.dim_128x128.png, /assets/generated/nav-icon-profile.dim_128x128.png.
Icons are visually consistent as a set (stroke weight, corner radii, and lighting), and readable at 20–24px sizes.

requirements.text: Ensure the Notifications unread-count badge displays correctly on the navigation surfaces whenever there are unread notifications (and remains hidden when the count is 0).

quotes: The icons are not shoing and the badge is also not shoing fix it

acceptanceCriteria: When getUnreadNotificationCount returns a value > 0, the badge is visible on the Notifications nav item in both the sidebar/nav list and the mobile bottom nav.
When the unread count is 0, the badge is not shown (no stray “0” visible in the UI).

requirements.text: Restore the Owner badge display so users with the Owner role visibly see the Owner badge on their profile near the username, consistent with the existing RoleBadge component styling.

quotes: The navigation footer bar has no icons and the owner badge

acceptanceCriteria: If a profile’s role is Owner, the profile page displays the gold Owner badge near the username.
If a profile’s role is not Owner/Admin, no role badge is shown.
Backend still assigns the first signed-up user the immutable Owner role (no regression).

requirements.text: Add the user-provided uploaded image as the app logo by updating all places that currently render the existing Sach Wave logo to use the new logo asset.

quotes: Yes and also add this as a logo
Do it by yourself make the suitable icons

acceptanceCriteria: The app uses the new logo in the desktop sidebar header, mobile header, and splash screen (all locations currently showing the Sach Wave logo).
The logo renders crisply on dark backgrounds and at small sizes (e.g., 32–40px) without unwanted white-box artifacts (handle transparency or background appropriately).

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if a state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Redesigning the overall UI theme beyond fixing the missing icons/badges and swapping the logo.
Adding new navigation destinations or changing route structure.
Adding third-party icon libraries that require network loading at runtime.

edits: Replace app logo artwork using the uploaded logo image (sach-wave-logo.dim_512x512.png > sach-wave-logo-v2.dim_512x512.png)

preferencesToAdd: Use English for all user-facing UI text
